Name: Stela of Ka-yunu-hetep Khenmesu
Description: The surface of this stela is divided into two separate sections. The upper half contains ten columns of inscription, separated by a simple line. Underneath these on the left a man is depicted sitting in front of an offering table with loaves, oxen and fowl. On the right another man is standing facing the scene. A line of text runs across the top of the scene, containing the name of Senwosret II. The stela is framed by a simple line. Both text and representations are carved, the latter also contain some inner detail.
